Summary: Batman and Superman have a love/hate relationship going on due to some misunderstandings and unexpressed emotions. entry.title: Colors
entry.summary:
Author: ladyshipper06

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,435Chapters: 3/5Kudos: 68

Summary: “Why didn’t you tell me?” Bruce’s voice cuts him off. It’s low, rough, almost a whisper, but it carries something deeper than reproach. Clark knows it. His blue-gray eyes lock onto Clark’s, and for a moment the world seems to stop. His gaze is clear, cold, but not harsh. There’s no judgment. No anger. Just a quiet understanding. Clark looks down at the mug. He swallows and shakes his head, tormented. “I didn’t know,” he replies, his voice breaking. There’s exhaustion in his tone. What makes him tremble isn’t fear—it’s disappointment. Disappointment in himself. His expression, usually calm, looks lost, disoriented, as if every word Bruce speaks is stabbing him, even though he knows that isn’t his intent. Bruce watches him. There’s nothing in his eyes that suggests disbelief, but Clark can’t quite read him. The city’s night light spills in through the window, illuminating Bruce’s tired face, dark circles beneath his eyes. [...] What would have happened if Batman were present in the 2025 Superman movie?

Summary: Strange changes in Clark turns out to be another version of Kryptonian Puberty and he needs help. It's a good thing Batman always has eyes on Superman... Excerpt: 'Clark pokes at his pie some more, playing with his food as a stalling tactic. “I’ve reached the third stage of Kryptonian maturity. I didn’t even realize I passed the second stage since it seemed like normal teenager’s puberty– I thought I was just a late bloomer before the Fortress was around to reveal my sex.” Clark explains. Bruce processes this, thinking of the previous information he had gathered from the Fortress Of Solitude. The Third Stage of Kryptonian Maturity? “You’re… fertile?” Clark buries his head in his hands, dropping his spoon with a loud clatter.' entry.title: Bat sitting
entry.summary:
Author: NightTwink73

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,781Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 16

Summary: In a week, Bruce and Clark will be celebrating their sixth wedding anniversary, and Clark is determined to have some time alone with Bruce—just the two of them. The only problem? Alfred is out of town, leaving the chaos of their four energetic and unpredictable children in need of supervision. What starts as a simple search for a babysitter quickly turns into a series of hilarious—and sometimes disastrous—trial runs, with Lois, Barry, and even Diana stepping in at different points. Between the boys’ wild schemes, unexpected mishaps, and the constant threat of a domestic disaster, Clark and Bruce must navigate parenting, romance, and a little mischief to carve out the quiet evening they’ve been dreaming of… if anyone—or anything—lets them.

entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 99,449Chapters: 34/?Kudos: 1,218

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.title: And you can quote me on that
entry.summary:
Author: maruja35

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,425Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 36

Summary: In a deviation from expectations, Clark and Bruce meet for the first time not as Superman and Batman, and not as reporter and billionaire business owner, but as some version of themselves somewhere in the middle of all their respective identities.Clark nods, pushes his glasses back into place, smiles. It's sweet. It's comfortable. Bruce feels a sense of peace — there's no need to rush this. He steals one last kiss, then walks back to his car.He remembers to text Clark later, when he's back at the manor and before patrol, letting him know he made it home safe and wishing him a good night.He sees Clark again, unplanned, unexpected, Saturday night.OrAfter the Rift, Clark keeps moving. He's a bit lonely, a bit less trusted than he was before, a bit optimistic about a budding new friendship - relationship? He's determined not to mess things up, but he will. Things never work out just right. Meanwhile, Bruce throws caution to the wind and lets someone in for a change. He thinks it's fine, until he makes eye contact with him from across the room and feels the cool knife of betrayal slide between his ribs. It only gets more complicated from there.

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,015Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 442

Summary: “B?”Bruce turned around slowly. Tim knew something was very, very, wrong before Bruce even said anything. He was too tense, and his hair was different. It was greyer, and he had an ever so slightly smaller frame. That and he was looking at Tim in a way he never had before.“Who the hell are you?” Bruce asked.This wasn’t his Bruce.He might have accidentally sent his Bruce across universes.~~~When Tim accidentally hits Bruce with his quantum displacer, he and his brothers are left with an emotionally constipated Bruce that has a very different home life than their own.When Bruce arrives in an alternate universe, he quickly finds out that this universes Bruce is nothing like him.They each leave their mark while trying to get home.
